question: Determine True or False: This is the leading note in E major. <image 1>
description:
The image shows a musical staff with a single note placed on the second line from the bottom. The note is a quarter note (indicated by the filled-in oval head and stem). There is also a clef symbol at the beginning of the staff, which appears to be a bass clef, indicating that the staff represents the lower range of pitches.

Based on this description, the note is located on the G line of the bass clef staff. In the key of E major, the leading note (the seventh scale degree) is D#. Since the note shown is G, it does not correspond to the leading note in E major.

Therefore, the correct answer to the question is:

B. False
